|Title=Interpret a direct and consensual photomotor reflex (see item 81)
|Description=None
|Rubric=Multimedia content
|Contributors=
|Order=4}}

[[File:Normal and pathological direct and consensual photomotor reflex.jpg|alt=Normal and pathological direct and consensual photomotor reflex|centric|vignette|628x628px|Normal and pathological direct and consensual photomotor reflex. In this example, the right eye is illuminated]]

question.title: What is the expected response to a direct and consensual photomotor reflex?
question.description: A direct and consensual photomotor reflex is a response to light stimulation in both eyes.

option_a.title: Abnormal pupillary response
option_a.description: A response that is not normal or expected.

option_b.title: Convergent deviation
option_b.description: A condition where the eyes deviate inward.

option_c.title: Convergent response
option_c.description: A response where both eyes move inward.

option_d.title: Divergent deviation
option_d.description: A condition where the eyes deviate outward.

correct_option.title: C
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the answer option.
